Pre-Game Insights: The New York Mets have a 46-35 record at home and an overall 89-73 record.
The Los Angeles Dodgers have a 46-35 record on the road and an overall 98-64 record.
The series is tied 1-1 entering Game 3.
The Dodgers hold a 5-3 advantage in the season series between the two teams.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mets players include Pete Alonso with 31 doubles, 34 home runs, and 88 RBI, while Mark Vientos is 14-for-40 with two doubles and three home runs over the past 10 games.
Dodgers players include Shohei Ohtani with 38 doubles, seven triples, 54 home runs, and 130 RBI, while Teoscar Hernandez is 12-for-38 with four home runs and 12 RBI over the past 10 games.
Mets have a 6-4 record and a.221 batting average in their last 10 games, outscoring opponents by seven runs.
Dodgers have a 7-3 record and a.263 batting average in their last 10 games, outscoring opponents by 27 runs.
Others: Injuries for Mets include Paul Blackburn, Christian Scott, Sean Reid-Foley, Dedniel Nunez, Drew Smith, Brooks Raley, and Ronny Mauricio.
Injuries for Dodgers include Miguel Rojas, Alex Vesia, Brusdar Graterol, Gavin Stone, Tyler Glasnow, Clayton Kershaw, River Ryan, Dustin May, Connor Brogdon, Emmet Sheehan, and Tony Gonsolin.
